intro: Galium pusillum subsp. idubedae, commonly known as the dwarf bedstraw, is a small herbaceous plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers that bloom in early summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors or stream banks. Its botanical features make it a valuable component of diverse ecological systems.
